Dear Kevin Eaton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000214
Special Investigation Intake Date: December 16, 2024
License #: CO610385814
Licensee Group Organization: 14th Circuit Court
Licensee Designee: Alisha Riedl

Agency Name: Muskegon County Juvenile Detention Center
Agency Address: 205 E APPLE AVE
MUSKEGON, MI 49442-3406
License Status: Inspected
License Expiration Date: 07/30/2025
Capacity: 32

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employment policies and procedures; establishment
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In October 2024, an adult staff member picked up a youth and
friend and provided them drugs and alcohol. The staff member
then attempted to kiss the youth and touch the youth in a sexual
manner. The youth knows the staff member from the facility they
are employed at because the youth has been in and out of the
detention center. The youth was not at the facility when this took
place.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at her school on
December 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Youth A reported she has been at the facility
on different occasions, noting she was there for a few days at the
end of August 2024 and returned to the facility at the end of
October 2024. Youth A reported in October 2024, while she was
discharged from the facility, she was hanging out with a friend and
drinking alcohol. She reported that her friend, who is 18 years old,
had called someone to pick them up. When asked for additional
information about her friend, Youth A stated she did not want to
provide any information about her friend and did not matter since
her friend is 18 years old. Youth A reported after she got into the
car, she realized Staff 1 was the driver of the vehicle. She
reported Staff 1 drove her and her friend to another friend’s home.
Youth A reported Staff 1 provided them with alcohol and asked
them if they wanted the drug “e”, which Youth A admitted to
taking. She denied Staff 1 ever attempting to touch her sexually
and reported that he “hooked up” with her friend upstairs while she
was downstairs. Youth A reported Staff 1 maintained appropriate
boundaries. She reported when she was admitted back to the
facility at the end of October 2024, she did not have any contact
with Staff 1 and denied Staff 1 ever telling her to not talk about this
situation. Youth A reported during her previous stay at the facility
2

in August 2024, Staff 1 was professional, and she did not have
that much contact with her. She denied staff at the facility talking
or touching her inappropriately and denied staff ever writing notes
or bringing in contraband while she was placed there.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Staff 1 did have a Union Representative on
phone during the interview. Staff 1 reported he was unaware of
what the allegations were entailing and was told he was put on
administrative leave due to a Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA)
allegation was made. Law Enforcement reviewed the allegations
with Staff 1, and he denied any of the allegations were true. Staff
1 reported, “Youth A is lying on me.” He reported he has never
seen Youth A outside of the facility, never provided her with
alcohol or drugs, and never touched her sexually. Staff 1 reported
he does not know why Youth A would make these allegations. He
reported, "I just come in and do my job and some of the youth do
not like to be held accountable for their actions." Staff 1 reported
he is aware he is to not have any interactions with youth that have
been placed at this facility outside of the facility and if he saw a
youth in the community, he would walk the other way. He reported
he has never had inappropriate boundaries with the youth at the
facility, never passed notes, and never brought in contraband for
the youth. Staff 1 reported the facility runs a tight ship and noted
everything is watched on camera. He denied ever using any drugs
in his personal and work life.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed
together face to face at the facility on December 18, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 received a Prison Rape
Elimination Act (PREA) allegation from Youth B on December 11,
2024. This allegation stated Youth B reported Youth A had sexual
interactions with Staff 1 while Youth A was discharged from the
facility. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 was placed on leave
immediately while an internal investigation was going to be
completed. Administrator 2 reported they spoke with Youth A on
December 13, 2024, who reported Staff 1 had picked her and a
friend up to go drink alcohol. Youth A disclosed she confronted
Staff 1 about working at the facility and he denied working at the
facility. She reported Staff 1 provided her friend and herself with
alcohol and put an “e-pill” drug in their drinks. Youth A reported
she was going to have sexual intercourse with Staff 1 and her
friend but then when Staff 1 kissed her she felt weird, so she left.
Administrator 2 reported she asked Youth A if there were ever
3

concerning interactions with Staff 1 while she was at the facility
and Youth A denied this. Youth A reported Staff 1 did speak with
her and told her to not talk about the interaction they had when
she was readmitted to the facility. Administrator 1 reported Youth
A was placed at the facility from August 12, 2024 to August 23,
2024, and readmitted on October 31, 2024 to December 4, 2024.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 has written up concerns in his
human resource file for attendance and is pending a write-up due
to his professionalism in using swear words when speaking to
Supervisor. There have never been concerns about inappropriate
interactions with Staff 1 and youth at the facility. Administrator 1
and Administrator 2 reported there have been no concerns with
Staff 1 or any staff writing notes to youth, providing contraband to
youth or having inappropriate boundaries with youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 18, 2024. Youth B reported Staff 1 is a “rapist”. When
asked to explain, Youth B reported Youth A told him when she
was released from the facility, Staff 1 tried to have sex with her
and her friend. Youth B reported Youth A disclosed this because
he commented on Staff 1 not coming to their pod anymore when
Youth A was re-admitted. He reported he has never seen or heard
of Staff 1 having inappropriate boundaries with the youth at the
facility. Youth B reported he is concerned Staff 1 is using drugs
before he comes to work. He reported Staff 1 will look high
sometimes and explained that Staff 1 has bloodshot eyes and is
more sluggish. Youth B said when Staff 1 is high at the facility he
is not as strict as he is when he is sober about the rules. He
denied Staff 1 or any staff ever offering him drugs or contraband
at the facility. Youth B denied ever seeing or hearing of staff
writing notes to youth at the facility or having inappropriate
boundaries. He reported he has been in and out of this facility a
couple of times and is aware that staff are not to have interactions
with the youth when they are released from the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 18, 2024. Youth C reported he was in the same pod as
Youth A. He reported Youth A disclosed when she was released
from the facility, she “hooked up” with Staff 1. Youth C reported
Youth A lied about her age to Staff 1, so he thought she was not a
minor. He reported Youth A stated Staff 1 stopped coming to their
pod because he felt embarrassed about “hooking up” with her
while she was discharged. Youth C reported he has not seen or
heard of Staff 1 or any other staff having inappropriate boundaries
with youth, passing notes to youth, or providing youth contraband.
He reported he has been in and out of this facility several times
4

and knows staff are not to see the youth from the facility in the
community when they are released. Youth C denied ever seeing a
staff member from the facility in the community. He reported he is
concerned Staff 1 is high on drugs when he works at the facility.
Youth C explained he knows what being “high” looks like and
explained Staff 1 will have red eyes and be more go with the flow
on shifts. He reported that on other shifts when he is not high,
Staff 1 will be strict. Youth C reported he has heard Staff 1 is
using “E pills” and crack.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 18, 2024. Youth D reported he heard from Youth A
that when she was released from the facility, Staff 1 picked her
and her friend up to get them alcohol and drugs. He reported
Youth A disclosed Staff 1 had “sucked on her nipples” after she
was intoxicated. Youth D denied ever seeing Staff 1 or any other
staff have inappropriate boundaries with the youth at the facility.
He reported he has never seen or heard about staff passing notes
at the facility or providing contraband. Youth D reported he is
aware that staff cannot meet up with the youth when the youth are
discharged from the facility. He reported Staff 1 does act
professionally on the unit but is concerned Staff 1 may be high on
drugs when he is working. When asked to explain, Youth D
reported when Staff 1 is “high” on shift he will be sitting in a chair
more falling asleep, his eyes are red and will be more lenient on
the expectations of the youth for the day. He reported when Staff
1 is sober he is more irritable and stricter. Youth D reported he
has heard rumors that Staff 1 is using crack cocaine.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on December 20, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she does
not have any concerns about staff having inappropriate
boundaries at the facility and has not heard any rumors about this.
She reported she does work with Staff 1 and does not have any
concerns. Staff 2 denied hearing or seeing concerns about staff
meeting up with youth post-discharge from the facility, passing
notes, or bringing in contraband. When asked if there are any
concerns about staff coming to work under the influence of drugs
or alcohol, Staff 2 denied ever seeing or hearing about this
concern. Staff 2 reported the youth like to say staff look high when
the staff member is tired. She reported she knows that staff are
not supposed to meet up with youth outside the facility and
acknowledged being aware of the Code of Ethics and PREA
policy.
5

Supervisor was interviewed via phone on December 20, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she
directly supervises Staff 1 and does not have any concerns. She
denied hearing of any concerns about Staff 1 meeting up with
youth outside the facility or having inappropriate boundaries at the
facility. Supervisor reported she is unaware of any concerns about
him being under the influence of substances while working at the
facility. She reported there is a policy in place that staff are not to
meet up with youth in the community when they have been
discharged from the facility.
Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on December 17,
2024. Probation Officer reported he was not aware of these
allegations and stated Youth A has never disclosed these
concerns to him. He reported Youth A has been released from the
facility for a few weeks and has an ankle monitor which she has
been compliant with. Probation Officer reported Youth A has a
history of engaging in sexual activity with older men. He reported
he has not had a concern about safety at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been
employed at the facility since October 30, 2023. The only
disciplinary actions noted with his file is due to attendance
issues. Staff 1 is complaint with all training regulations.
Staff 1 completed the Code of Ethics training on October
30, 2024, Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) training on
November 2, 2023, and Professional boundaries training on
November 2, 2023.
- Facility’s Code of Ethics Policy- This policy notes, “Staff
member will not seek, encourage, or engage in any
relationship or communication with residents (or former
residents) which is not directly related to their professional
responsibilities, whether in the facility or out, without first
receiving the authorization of the facility Superintendent or
Assistance Superintendent/Clinical Director.” The Code of
Ethics also address that staff should be sober of all
substances when acting in their role at the facility.
- Facility’s Professional Boundaries Policy- This policy
notes, “Any behavior displayed by staff members that is
indictive of unprofessional relationship is prohibited. Such
behaviors, activities and relationship include, but are not
limited to the following: Establishing inappropriate
emotional boundaries with residents wherein the
6

boundaries or staff/resident relationships are blurred (i.e.
developing a friendship with residents, keeping secrets with
residents, making promises, calling residents “pet” names,
sharing personal information such as personal past history,
demographic information, etc.”
- Facility’s Prisons Rape Elimination Act (PREA) Policy-
This policy notes, “The goal of PREA is to prevent, detect
and eliminate sexual abuse and sexual harassment of
residents in correctional facility; this includes resident on
resident and staff on resident. Muskegon County Juvenile
Detention Center has policy and standards for employees
that prohibits them from becoming inappropriately
personally involved with youthful offenders in our care.”
- Email dated January 10, 2025, with Law Enforcement-
Law Enforcement reported there will be no criminal charges
pressed within this case and the case is closed.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as per Youth A’s interview,
she reported she did see Staff 1 post discharge from the facility,
but this was not planned, and Staff 1 denies any of these events
occurring. Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D never witnessed any
inappropriate actions between Youth A and Staff 1. They did
though report concerns of Staff 1 being under the influence of
substances which Staff 1 denied and there was no evidence to
support this. As per Supervisor and Staff 2 there has been no
concerns of Staff 1 being under the influence and reported the
youth like to say that when a staff member is tired.
Consultation:
Consultant provided consultation to Administrator 1 and
Administrator 2 of the concerns of Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
reporting Staff 1 appears to be under the influence of substance
while working at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
January 16, 2025

Cathrine Raftery Date
